document_data.name: Partisan
document_data.mainbody: A '''partisan''' was a member of the [[spear]] family of [[polearm]]s, being particularly similar to the [[spetum]] and [[ranseur]] in design,<ref><ref group="note" name="Combo">The partisan could possibly be considered a "combination weapon," what with its small axeheads, but since its primary purpose is thrusting it's considered a member of the spear family. to the point that it was not uncommon to confuse them.
document_data.Description: Partisans consisted of [[spear]],{{Cite dragon/331/The Point of Pole Arms|25}} with a long reach courtesy of a shaft that measured {{SIrange|8|10|ft}} in length. The heads of these spears were double-edged and large enough to support engraving and ornamentation. Directly below this spear head, two flukes or "[[axe]]-like spikes" protruded diagonally from the base.
document_data.Weaponology: This weapon was primarily used for thrusting at and piercing opponents', but the two flukes protruding from below the spearhead gave the weapon greater utility of cutting and slashing attacks. They also improved the partisan's penetrating potential, offered a defensive potential to the user, and could be used to catch and break an opponent's weapon.<ref name="A&EG-p87 />
document_data.Availability:
Places in the Realms where one could purchase partisans included:
* The [[Weaponers of Cormyr]].
document_data.Notable Owners: * The [[Ravenian]] merchant [[Bendekar]] had multiple partisans in his [[Bendekar's House|home's]] expansive weapons collection.{{Cite organized play/LC/A Handful of Dust|37}}
